description: Scaled Chebyshev U-polynomials evaluated at sqrt(3)/2; expansion of 1/(1-3*x+3*x^2).
comments: With different sign pattern, see A000748.a(n) = 6a(n-1)-15a(n-2)+20a(n-3)-15a(n-4)+6a(n-5). - _Paul Curtz_, Nov 21 2007Conjecture: Let M be any endomorphism on any vector space, such that M^3 = 1 (identity). Then (1-M)^n = A057681(n)-A057682(n)*M+z(n)*M^2, where z(0)=z(1)=0 and, apparently, z(n+2)=a(n). - _Stanislav Sykora_, Jun 10 2012
